required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multicenter 12 Months Clinical Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Ranibizumab Alone or in Combination With Laser Photocoagulation vs. Laser Photocoagulation Alone in Proliferative Diabetic Retinopathy (PRIDE)
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter Randomized Open-label Three-arms Controlled 12 Months Clinical Proof of Concept Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Ranibizumab Alone or in Combination With Laser Photocoagulation vs. Laser Photocoagulation Alone in Proliferative Diabetic Retinopathy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to assess the efficacy and safety of the anti-Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor (VEGF) agent ranibizumab (0.5 mg) with or without Panretinal laser photocoagulation (PRP) compared to PRP alone in patients with Proliferative Diabetic Retinopathy (PDR).

detailed_description.textblock: A 12-month core phase was followed by a 12-month observational follow-up phase (physician's routine), for a planned individual study duration of 24-25 months. A separate informed consent was signed for the 12-month observational follow-up phase. This study was conducted in Germany.

study_design_info.masking_description: An open-label design was chosen in which the evaluation of the primary objective was performed by a reading center. The reading center that evaluated the primary and several secondary objectives was blinded to randomization and therefore assessed these objectives uninfluenced by treatment information. However, laser burns were visible on the images, and no full blinding regarding panretinal laser photocoagulation (PRP) was possible for the reading center.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Area of Neovascularizations (NVs) at End of Core Study (EOCS)
primary_outcome.description: The area of neovascularizations (NV) was assessed by a central reading center via fluorescein angiography (FA) images. The area of NV was calculated as the sum of area of neovascularization of the disc (NVD) and neovascularization elsewhere (NVE) and was recorded in square millimeters. A higher positive change value may indicate a greater formation of new, abnormal blood vessels and thus disease progression. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Area of Neovascularizations (NVs) at Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: The area of neovascularizations (NV) was assessed by a central reading center via fluorescein angiography (FA) images. The area of NV was calculated as the sum of area of neovascularization of the disc (NVD) and neovascularization elsewhere (NVE) and was recorded in square millimeters. A higher positive change value may indicate a greater formation of new, abnormal blood vessels and thus disease progression. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) (ETDRS Letters) at EOCS
secondary_outcome.description: BCVA was assessed using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)-like charts at a testing distance of 4 meters. A higher number of ETDRS letters may indicate better visual acuity. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Change From Baseline in BCVA (ETDRS Letters) at EOCS
secondary_outcome.description: BCVA was assessed using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)-like charts at a testing distance of 4 meters. No clinically relevant change was defined as <5 letters gain or loss. A higher positive change value may indicate a greater improvement in visual acuity. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Change From Baseline in ETDRS Severity Grade of Diabetic Retinopathy (DR) at EOCS
secondary_outcome.description: The severity level of diabetic retinopathy was determined using the ETDRS severity scale. However, in contrast to the original ETDRS severity scale, wide field fluorescein angiography images were used in addition to color fundus photography for identification of NVs and prior PRP treatment was not considered for determining the severity level. Eyes could be graded in the following classes: "DR absent" (10), "questionable DR" (14,15), "NPDR" (20-53), "mild PDR" (60-61), "moderate PDR" (65), "high risk PDR" (71-75), "advanced PDR" (81-85) and "cannot grade" (90). One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis. No statistical analysis was conducted for ≥ 1 class deterioration or ≥ 2 class deterioration from Baseline at EOCS because ratios could not be calculated in case of zero frequencies in at least one of the three treatment groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Central Subfield Thickness at EOCS
secondary_outcome.description: Central subfield retinal thickness was assessed by a central reading center using Optical Coherence Tomography images. A positive change value may indicate disease progression. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Foveal Center Point Retinal Thickness at EOCS
secondary_outcome.description: Foveal center point retinal thickness was assessed by a central reading center using Optical Coherence Tomography images. A positive change value may indicate disease progression. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Ranibizumab Injections Until EOCS
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of ranibizumab injections until EOCS was calculated. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis. No statistical analysis was conducted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of PRP Laser Spots Until EOCS
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of PRP laser spots from baseline until EOCS was calculated. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis. No statistical analysis was conducted.

arm_group.description: Interventional Core Phase: One intravitreal injection of ranibizumab 0.5 mg to the study eye monthly until stability regarding morphological parameters is confirmed (ie, no further improvement of morphology or no worsening of morphology for 3 consecutive months)

Interventional Core Phase: Panretinal laser photocoagulation (PRP) treatment administered to the study eye in accordance with the modified diabetic retinopathy study (DRS) guidelines for panretinal laser photocoagulation procedures

Interventional Core Phase: Ranibizumab 0.5 mg as described for the ranibizumab mono arm and PRP treatment as described for the PRP mono arm until stability regarding morphological parameters is confirmed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Proliferative Diabetic Retinopathy
- Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) in study eye of at least 20 Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) letters (20/400)
- Type 1 or type 2 diabetes under medical surveillance / with stabilized treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Proliferative vitreoretinopathy in study eye
- Clinically significant macular edema (CSME) in the study eye
- Clinically non significant macular edema (CNSME) that is likely to develop to CSME in the study eye
- Uncontrolled glaucoma in either eye
- Other protocol-specified conditions

patient_data.ipd_description: Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent review panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations. This trial data availability is according to the criteria and process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were screened for eligibility at 23 German study sites and randomized at 22 of the 23 sites.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The number of patients in the protocol section (107) excludes one patient in the Ranibizumab mono arm who withdrew prior to the baseline visit. The number of patients in the Randomized Set (108) includes this patient. A separate Informed Consent was signed for the Non-Interventional Follow Up Phase

group.title: Ranibizumab Mono
group.description: Interventional Core Phase: One intravitreal injection of ranibizumab 0.5 mg to the study eye monthly until stability regarding morphological parameters is confirmed (ie, no further improvement of morphology or no worsening of morphology for 3 consecutive months) Non-interventional Follow-Up Phase: Treatment per physician´s routine standard of care until Month 24

group.title: PRP Mono
group.description: Interventional Core Phase: Panretinal laser photocoagulation (PRP) treatment administered to the study eye in accordance with the modified diabetic retinopathy study (DRS) guidelines for panretinal laser photocoagulation procedures. If stability of morphological parameters could not be confirmed after 3 months, additional laser treatment was initiated. Non-Interventional Follow-Up Phase: Treatment per physician´s routine standard of care until Month 24.

group.title: Ranibizumab+PRP
group.description: Interventional Core Phase: Ranibizumab 0.5 mg as described for the ranibizumab mono arm and PRP treatment as described for the PRP mono arm until stability regarding morphological parameters is confirmed Non-interventional Follow-Up Phase: Treatment per physician´s routine standard of care until Month 24

participants_list.participants: 1 patient exited after completing Core Phase and did not start the Follow-Up Phase
5 patients exited after completing Core Phase and did not start the Follow-Up Phase
3 patients exited after completing Core Phase and did not start the Follow-Up Phase

If stability of morphological parameters could not be confirmed after 3 months, additional laser treatment was initiated. Non-Interventional Follow-Up Phase: Treatment per physician´s routine standard of care until Month 24.

group.title: Ranibizumab+PRP
group.description: Interventional Core Phase: Ranibizumab 0.5 mg as described for the ranibizumab mono arm and PRP treatment as described for the PRP mono arm until stability regarding morphological parameters is confirmed Non-interventional Follow-Up Phase: Treatment per physician´s routine standard of care until Month 24

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Area of Neovascularizations (NVs) at End of Core Study (EOCS)
outcome.description: The area of neovascularizations (NV) was assessed by a central reading center via fluorescein angiography (FA) images. The area of NV was calculated as the sum of area of neovascularization of the disc (NVD) and neovascularization elsewhere (NVE) and was recorded in square millimeters. A higher positive change value may indicate a greater formation of new, abnormal blood vessels and thus disease progression. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.
outcome.population: FAS; LOCF. Only patients with both values at baseline and any post-baseline value were included.

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Change From Baseline in ETDRS Severity Grade of Diabetic Retinopathy (DR) at EOCS
outcome.description: The severity level of diabetic retinopathy was determined using the ETDRS severity scale. However, in contrast to the original ETDRS severity scale, wide field fluorescein angiography images were used in addition to color fundus photography for identification of NVs and prior PRP treatment was not considered for determining the severity level. Eyes could be graded in the following classes: "DR absent" (10), "questionable DR" (14,15), "NPDR" (20-53), "mild PDR" (60-61), "moderate PDR" (65), "high risk PDR" (71-75), "advanced PDR" (81-85) and "cannot grade" (90). One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis. No statistical analysis was conducted for ≥ 1 class deterioration or ≥ 2 class deterioration from Baseline at EOCS because ratios could not be calculated in case of zero frequencies in at least one of the three treatment groups.
outcome.population: FAS. Only patients with both values at baseline and any post-baseline value were included.

outcome.title: Number of Ranibizumab Injections Until EOCS
outcome.description: The total number of ranibizumab injections until EOCS was calculated. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis. No statistical analysis was conducted.
outcome.population: Safety Set. This outcome measure was pre-specified for the ranibizumab mono and ranibizumab+PRP arms only.

measure.title: Number of Ranibizumab Injections Until EOCS
measure.description: The total number of ranibizumab injections until EOCS was calculated. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis. No statistical analysis was conducted.
measure.population: Safety Set. This outcome measure was pre-specified for the ranibizumab mono and ranibizumab+PRP arms only.

measurement_list.measurement: This outcome measure was pre-specified for the ranibizumab mono and ranibizumab+PRP arms only.

outcome.title: Number of PRP Laser Spots Until EOCS
outcome.description: The total number of PRP laser spots from baseline until EOCS was calculated. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis. No statistical analysis was conducted.
outcome.population: Safety Set. Only patients with at least 1 laser therapy until EOCS are included in the analysis. This outcome measure was pre-specified for the PRP and the ranibizumab+PRP arms only.

group.title: Ranibizumab Mono
group.description: Interventional Core Phase: One intravitreal injection of ranibizumab 0.5 mg to the study eye monthly until stability regarding morphological parameters is confirmed (ie, no further improvement of morphology or no worsening of morphology for 3 consecutive months)

group.title: PRP Mono
group.description: Interventional Core Phase: Panretinal laser photocoagulation (PRP) treatment administered to the study eye in accordance with the modified diabetic retinopathy study (DRS) guidelines for panretinal laser photocoagulation procedures

group.title: Ranibizumab+PRP
group.description: Interventional Core Phase: Ranibizumab 0.5 mg as described for the ranibizumab mono arm and PRP treatment as described for the PRP mono arm until stability regarding morphological parameters is confirmed

measure.title: Number of PRP Laser Spots Until EOCS
measure.description: The total number of PRP laser spots from baseline until EOCS was calculated. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis. No statistical analysis was conducted.
measure.population: Safety Set. Only patients with at least 1 laser therapy until EOCS are included in the analysis. This outcome measure was pre-specified for the PRP and the ranibizumab+PRP arms only.

measurement_list.measurement: This outcome measure was pre-specified for the PRP and the ranibizumab+PRP arms only.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events (AEs) were collected from time of informed consent until 4 weeks after the patient has stopped study participation (approximately 2 years).
reported_events.desc: The Safety Set consisted of all randomized patients with at least one post-baseline safety assessment.

group.title: Ranibizumab Mono Until Month 12
group.description: All visits up to Month 12 (which could lie after EOCS for patients who discontinued the core phase of the study)

group.title: PRP Mono Until Month 12
group.description: All visits up to Month 12 (which could lie after EOCS for patients who discontinued the core phase of the study)

group.title: Ranibizumab+PRP Until Month 12
group.description: All visits up to Month 12 (which could lie after EOCS for patients who discontinued the core phase of the study)

group.title: Ranibizumab Mono Month 12 to 24
group.description: Non-interventional follow up phase

group.title: PRP Mono Month 12 to 24
group.description: Non-interventional follow up phase

group.title: Ranibizumab+PRP Month 12 to 24
group.description: Non-interventional follow up phase

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: FOREIGN BODY SENSATION IN EYES (Left eye)
FOREIGN BODY SENSATION IN EYES (Right eye)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (ie, data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
